t: For*pn Zion’s sake I will not hold My peace, And*ld for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, Until*ld her righteousness goes forth as brightness, And*ld her salvation as a lamp that*i burns.
The*ld Gentiles shall see your righteousness, And*ld all kings your glory. You*ld shall be called by a new name, Which*ld the mouth of the Lord*s will name.
You*ld shall also be a crown of glory In*ld the hand of the Lord,*s And*ld a royal diadem In*ld the hand of your God.

You*ld shall no longer be termed Forsaken, Nor*ld shall your land any more be termed Desolate; But*ld you shall be called Hephzibah, and your land Beulah; For*ld the Lord*s delights in you, And*ld your land shall be married.
For*ld as*i a young man marries a virgin, So*ild shall your sons marry you; And*ld as*i the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, So*ild shall your God rejoice over you.
I*ln have set watchmen on your walls, O Jerusalem; They*ld shall never hold their peace day or night. You*ld who make mention of the Lord,*s do not keep silent,
And*ld give Him no rest till He establishes And*ld till He makes Jerusalem a praise in the earth.

The*ln Lord*s has sworn by His right hand And*ld by the arm of His strength: “Surely*ld I will no longer give your grain As*ild food for your enemies; And*ld the sons of the foreigner shall not drink your new wine, For*ld which you have labored.
But*ld those who have gathered it shall eat it, And*ld praise the Lord;*s Those*ld who have brought it together shall drink it in My holy courts.”
Go*ln through, Go*ld through the gates! Prepare*ld the way for the people; Build*ld up, Build*ld up the highway! Take*ld out the stones, Lift*ld up a banner for the peoples!

Indeed*ln the Lord*s has proclaimed To*ld the end of the world: “Say*ld to the daughter of Zion, ‘Surely*ld your salvation is coming; Behold,*ld His reward is*i with Him, And*ld His work before Him.’”
And*ld they shall call them The Holy People, The*ld Redeemed of the Lord;*s And*ld you shall be called Sought Out, A*ld City Not Forsaken.
